docs.lead_paragraph: The Democrats are promising to lower drug costs for older Americans, provide more money for children’s health insurance and expand research using embryonic stem cells.

headline.main: Confident Democrats Draft Broad Health Care Agenda
headline.print_headline: Confident Democrats Draft Broad Health Care Agenda

docs.snippet: The Democrats are promising to lower drug costs for older Americans, provide more money for children’s health insurance and expand research using embryonic stem cells.

docs.lead_paragraph: New York State's highest court ruled yesterday that the Roman Catholic Church and other religious organizations must abide by a state law that requires most employee health insurance policies to cover the cost of contraception. The 6-to-0 decision by the Court of Appeals upheld rulings by the State Supreme Court and the Appellate Division, and left intact the state's Women's Health and Wellness Act of 2002, which requires company health insurance policies that provide coverage for prescription drugs to include ''coverage for the cost of contraceptive drugs or devices.''

headline.main: State Court Rules Against Catholic Church on Insurance

docs.lead_paragraph: If doctors know that patients can help themselves without taking drugs, but they also know that patients are not likely to follow this advice, what should they do?

docs.lead_paragraph: Thailand is a leader in H.I.V. prevention but has made little headway in easing the stigma against the disease.

headline.main: In Thailand, More Survive AIDS, Only to Face Rejection
headline.print_headline: In Thailand, More Survive AIDS, Only to Face Rejection

docs.snippet: Thailand is a leader in H.I.V. prevention but has made little headway in easing the stigma against the disease.

docs.lead_paragraph: OF all the bullets that have torn through all the lives of victims of gang shootouts in this city besieged by Bloods, Crips, guns and drugs, the tiny missile that spiraled into the cherubic face of 7-year-old Tajahnique Lee -- shearing her tongue, knocking out teeth -- bore not only through flesh and bone but also lodged near the heart of Trenton's sense of collective outrage. It is not that the crack of gunfire is a novelty in this struggling city, which for most of the decade has ranked among the nation's most violent cities per person. This spring, in the 48 hours before Tajahnique was wounded, five other people were shot in this state capital where 75,000 people occupy roughly eight square miles in a mix of row house neighborhoods amid looming state office towers filled on weekdays with more than half of New Jersey's 80,000 state workers.
docs.abstract: Aricle on increase in gang activity in New York City metropolitan area, driven by persistence of drug trade, parolees who return to streets with deeper knowledge of gang rituals and pop culture icons who romanticize gang lifestyle; experts say those factors add to increasingly stratified class system for poor and racial and ethnic minorities in small to midsize cities around region; say gangs have spread from urban centers to suburban, and more affluent, communities; several recent shootings described; photos (L)
